name: Adian's Rod
effect:
When you play this item, you may assign to it the game text of a weapon you can spot. This effect lasts until the end of the turn.
Adian was a powerful Wavemaster PC.
To Play/To Flip: Discard 3 cards, each of a different element OR sacrifice a Lv. 1 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Wavemaster.

name: Air Wand
effect:
A basic Wavemaster wand.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Wavemaster.

name: Albert
effect:
He says you guys are all wussies.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice 2 goblins.
Reward: Destroy an item.

name: Alpha Ichigoro
effect:
When Alpha Ichigoro wins a fight, you may place a card from your discard pile on top of your deck.
Bonjour! I am Alpha Ichigoro.

name: Arrow Fish
effect:
The scales of this burrowing fish can be used to heal.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 2 hidden cards.
Reward: Heal a PC.

name: Axe Bomber
effect:
When you play this item, you may reveal your opponent’s hand and discard a revealed card.
A single blow can destroy a shield or helm.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a lv. 2 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Heavy Axeman.

name: Baby Worm
effect:
Babies need lots of different elements if they’re going to mature.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 4 different elements.
Reward: Opponent sacrifices an elemental card.

name: Battle Axe
effect:
Only a PC of the Heavy Axeman class is able to bear such a powerful weapon.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Heavy Axeman.

name: Bear
effect:
When you draw destiny for your PC, if that destiny card is an action, you may play it.
I can lend you a hand if you need any help.

name: Bee Army
effect:
Storable – may attack when another monster attacks.
Bees like to fly from one element to another.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 2 different elements.
Reward: No reward.

name: Benkei
effect:
Benkei is strength +1 while he is bearing armor.
Morning! What’s up?

name: Black Rose
effect:
When you draw destiny for Black Rose, you may take that destiny card into your hand.
Okay, I’m here, you’d better be thankful.

name: Bt
effect:
When you play a hidden card, you may draw a card.
You’re not being a gentleman.

name: Cannibal
effect:
Storable – may attack when a goblin attacks.
After it beats you, it feasts.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a goblin.
Reward: Play a storable goblin from your discard pile to your portal.

name: Chicken Hand
effect:
Storable – may attack when a [Wood] monster attacks.
Beware the chicken fingers.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Play an action from your discard pile.

name: Collapsed, Smiling, Remnant
effect:
The first [Thunder] monster assigned to each fight is strength +1.
Monsters of the thunder element draw power from lightning storms.

name: Crim
effect:
When Crim wins a fight, you may make your opponent sacrifice a card.
It’s been too long. At last, I’m back!

name: Critical!
effect:
Give that PC strength +2 (or +3 if you have only 2 PCs, or +4 if you have only 1 PC).
Possible chance of inflicting double damage.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder]. Your PC must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Cursed, Despaired, Paradise
effect:
A PC fighting more than 1 [Darkness] monster draws 1 fewer destiny.
Despair and darkness breed fear and insecurity.

name: Cyclo Shark
effect:
This fish hits hard with a crushing water spell.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 2 hidden cards.
Reward: Your opponent sacrifices a monster. He or she may prevent this by sacrificing a hidden card.

name: Dark Rider
effect:
They wield great power and terror.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Darkness] [Darkness] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder].
Reward: Wound a PC.

name: Dark Witch
effect:
Storable – may attack when a [Darkness] monster attacks. On the turn this witch attacks, you determine the order fights are resolved.
Witches run away and cast spells from afar.
To Play/To Flip: Place 3 [Darkness] cards from your hand on top of your deck.
Reward: No reward.

name: Data Bug
effect:
Place that monster in your portal instead of destroying it.
Monsters infected by viruses are difficult to destroy.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Wood]. Your monster must be about to be destroyed.

name: Data Drain
effect:
Give that PC strength +3. If the PC wins the fight, you may perform the reward of a monster in that fight.
The power to alter monster data.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Darkness]. Wound your PC in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Deadly Moth
effect:
Storable – may attack when another monster attacks.
Flying creatures can see things hidden to others.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Reveal opponent’s hand.

name: Dryad's Sword
effect:
When you play this item, you may play an item from your discard pile.
The magical power of the Dryad can repair a broken weapon.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a lv. 2 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Heavy Blade.

name: Ectoplasm
effect:
Storable – may attack when a ghost or undead attacks.
Lurking in a portal, it radiates darkness energy.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: No reward.

name: Elk
effect:
When you play a PC, you may heal a PC.
Aromatic Grass… have you found any?

name: Enemy
effect:
A monster in your portal may attack this turn.
You never know what’s in a portal.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Fire]. You must have just played a monster to attack.

name: Enou
effect:
When you play this item, you may sacrifice its bearer to destroy a monster.
A fiery Twin Blade weapon that kills quickly.
To Play/To Flip: Return 3 hidden cards to their owners’ hands OR sacrifice a lv. 1 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Twin Blade.

name: Ensui
effect:
When you play this item, you may heal bearer.
Its water element provides magical healing.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Water] [Water] [Water] OR sacrifice a lv. 1 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Blademaster.

name: Escape
effect:
Place a storable monster in that fight in its owner’s portal.
You can run away from the smaller ones.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Earth]. Your PC must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Fiend Menhir
effect:
On the turn this idol attacks, a monster in your portal may attack, and must fight the same PC as this idol.
This boulder uses magic to heal monsters.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: No reward.

name: Fire Witch
effect:
Storable – may attack when a [Fire] monster attacks. On the turn this witch attacks, you may change one card to [Fire].
Her magic can set anything on fire.
To Play/To Flip: Place 3 [Fire] cards from your hand on top of your deck.
Reward: No reward.

name: Firedrake Mail
effect:
When you play a [Fire] card, you may place this card from your hand on top of your deck.
Crafted to protect against legendary monsters.
To Play/To Flip: Return a lv. 1 armor on bearer to your hand. Bearer may be any PC except a Wavemaster.

name: Flamberge
effect:
Standard Heavy Blade sword that is strong in the fire element.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Heavy Blade.

name: Flame Heads
effect:
Storable.
Its three-headed flaming breath is devastating.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Fire] [Fire].
Reward: Return your card in play to your hand. If that card is [Fire], draw a card.

name: Frost Armor
effect:
When you play this item, you may exchange up to 2 cards in your hand each with one of your hidden cards.
It’s hard to find things in the snow.
To Play/To Flip: Return a lv. 1 armor on bearer to your hand. Bearer may be any PC except a Wavemaster, Twin Blade, or Long Arm.

name: Gale Of Swords
effect:
If that Twin Blade wins the fight, you may play a card from your discard pile.
Slash at high speed like a dance.
To Play/To Flip: Your Twin Blade must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Game Over
effect:
For the rest of the game, when any player has no PCs in play, that player loses the game.
When each party member’s HP is 0, the game is over.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 4 PCs.

name: Gan Slash
effect:
Give that Blademaster strength +2 (or +3 if fighting a [Wood] monster).
Slash diagonally, and then slash diagonally from the other side.
To Play/To Flip: Your Blademaster must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Gardenia
effect:
When Gardenia wins a fight, you may return an attacking monster to its owner’s hand.
You have nothing to worry now that I’m here.

name: General Armor
effect:
It will pound you with its mace-like fist.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder].
Reward: Opponent places 3 cards from his or her discard pile under his or her deck.

name: Gladiator
effect:
They are trained to fight to the death.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder].
Reward: Take a monster from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Goblin
effect:
Storable – may attack when a goblin attacks.
They like to steal things and break them.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Destroy a item.

name: Goblin Night
effect:
Storable – may attack when a goblin attacks, and must fight the same PC.
They’re trained to fight alongside other goblins.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: No reward.

name: Goblin Wiz
effect:
Despite its size, it’s magical, tricky, and dangerous.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Draw a card.

name: Gott Statue
effect:
Play up to 2 items.
On the bottom level of every dungeon is a room with a special treasure.

name: Guardian
effect:
A mechanical creation with legs made from tree trunks.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a card.
Reward: Opponent sacrifices a card.

name: Halloween
effect:
Luckily, it only comes once a year.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness].
Reward: Discard a monster to perform its reward.

name: Hammer Shark
effect:
This fish is strength +1 for each other monster in its fight.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 4 hidden cards.
Reward: Your opponent sacrifices 2 monsters. He or she may prevent this by sacrificing 2 hidden cards.

name: Headhunter
effect:
Storable – may attack when a ghost or undead attacks.
It has lost its own and now looks for yours.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Darkness].
Reward: Wound a PC.

name: Heavy Metal
effect:
Storable – may attack when a warrior attacks.
It has a heart of steel and an axe to match.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Opponent places 2 cards from his or her discard pile under his or her deck.

name: Hell Doberman
effect:
Storable.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Return 2 of your cards in play to your hand. If both of them are [Fire], destroy a monster.

name: Hell Hound
effect:
On the turn this hound attacks, each [Fire] monster in your portal may attack.
Pack animals follow the biggest and strongest.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire].
Reward: Destroy all hidden cards.

name: Hell's Gate
effect:
When you play this item, you may make your opponent sacrifice a monster.
The Twin Blade uses speed for multiple attacks.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a lv. 2 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Twin Blade.

name: Hirami
effect:
Hirami is strength +2 while you can spot 2 or more different species of attacking monsters.
Yo, wanna know something?

name: Hobgoblin
effect:
Storable – may attack when a goblin attacks.
They organize roaming packs of goblins.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Play a storable goblin from your discard pile to your portal.

name: Hungry Grass
effect:
Covered with thorns and hard to defend against.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Your opponent sacrifices a card. He or she may prevent this by playing a PC.

name: Indiscreet, Gluttonous, Pilgrimage
effect:
When an [Earth] monster is sacrificed or destroyed, its owner may place it on top of his or her deck instead of the discard pile.
The strength of earth provides resilience.

name: Ironball Freak
effect:
You may perform the reward of each other monster in the same fight as this goblin an additional time.
Its two-hand bash attack is feared by all PCs.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a goblin.
Reward: No reward.

name: Jester's Wand
effect:
When you play this item on your turn, you may play another card that turn.
With this wand, the PC can alter time and space.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a lv. 2 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Wavemaster.

name: Jinsaran
effect:
When you play this item, you may make your opponent sacrifice a monster in his or her portal.
Double-edged with earth-based abilities.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a lv. 2 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Blademaster.

name: Juk Rom
effect:
Give that Wavemaster strength +2 (or +3 if fighting an [Earth] monster).
Generate a tornado with leaves.
To Play/To Flip: Your Wavemaster must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Juk Wipe
effect:
Assign an additional monster to fight that Long Arm.
Slash parallel to the ground. Range increases with level.
To Play/To Flip: You must be assigning a monster to fight your Long Arm.

name: Kite
effect:
When you draw destiny for Kite, you may draw 2 destiny cards and choose one to use (discard the other).
I want to help Orca.

name: Komura
effect:
When you play this item, you may reveal the top two cards of your deck and play any [Fire] card revealed.
Flames are most dangerous when they spread.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] OR sacrifice a lv. 1 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Blademaster.

name: La Repth
effect:
If that Wavemaster wins the fight, heal all of your PCs.
Recover target and any near-by member’s HP by 150.
To Play/To Flip: Your Wavemaster must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Lavaman Spear
effect:
When you play this item, you may draw a card.
A pole weapon with high fire element rating.
To Play/To Flip: Make your opponent destroy one of your monsters OR sacrifice a lv. 1 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Long Arm.

name: Living Dead
effect:
How can you kill it? It’s already dead.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness].
Reward: Place 2 cards from your discard pile on top of your deck.

name: Mad Grass
effect:
Storable – may attack when a plant attacks.
For the rest of the turn, your opponent must sacrifice a card to flip an action.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Sleep inducing magic from plants make PCs into sitting ducks.

name: Magical Goblin
effect:
Storable – may attack when a goblin attacks.
Seer and shaman, it glimpses the future.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Draw a card.

name: Mantis
effect:
This monster is strength +1 for each of your scored [Water] monsters.
Sometimes a mantis will destroy its own mate.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 4 hidden cards.
Reward: No reward.

name: Martina
effect:
She is the best goblin tag player.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice 2 goblins.
Reward: Draw 2 cards.

name: Menhir
effect:
On the turn this idol attacks, a monster in your portal may attack and is strength +2.
Makes any fight tougher when it heals damage dealt by PCs.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 3 of your PCs.
Reward: No reward.

name: Metal Goblin
effect:
Storable – may attack when a goblin attacks.
Makes a lot of noise by clanging its sword on its shield.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a goblin.
Reward: Destroy an item.

name: Mia
effect:
When you assign a monster to fight Mia, you may assign an additional monster to fight her.
I can’t wait to see the power of the bracelet today.

name: Midnight Axe
effect:
When you play this item, you may place a card from your opponent’s discard pile on top of his or her deck.
Darkness clouds the enemy’s plans.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a lv. 1 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Heavy Axeman.

name: Mimiru
effect:
The reward text of each monster fighting Mimiru is ignored.
Well, that’s a fine way to say hello.

name: Mistral
effect:
If Mistral is healthy when your opponent’s monsters attack, you may wound her to place a card from your discard pile on top of your deck.
Ha ha ha :) That’s so exciting! :D

name: Mushroom King
effect:
This fungus can magically enhance its own strength.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: On his or her next turn, your opponent can play only monsters and hidden cards.

name: Natsume
effect:
If Natsume is healthy when you draw destiny, you may wound her to add 1 to that destiny.
Thank you for choosing me! I will do my best!

name: Noble Cloak
effect:
When you play this item, you may exchange a card in your hand with one of your hidden cards.
Light body armor that can be worn by any PC.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer may be any PC.

name: Noisy Wisp
effect:
Storable – may attack when a ghost or undead attacks.
The moans and shrieks are enough to drive you mad.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Play a storable monster to your portal.

name: Nomadic Bones
effect:
Storable – may attack when a ghost or undead attacks.
Bones are supposed to stay buried.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Darkness] [Darkness].
Reward: Place a card from your discard pile on top of your deck.

name: Ochimusha
effect:
A runaway warrior, and a formidable opponent.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Thunder].
Reward: Take a monster from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Ogre
effect:
If you sacrifice a scored goblin to play this goblin, you may draw a card.
It’s big and bad and hits you with its hammer.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a goblin.
Reward: Draw a card.

name: Parasite Dragon
effect:
Few PCs know the lair of this dragon, feared for its breath attacks.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 6 different elements.
Reward: Destroy a monster.

name: Phantom Wing
effect:
Storable – may attack when another monster attacks.
Spot 3 different elements.
To Play/To Flip: Opponent returns his or her elemental card in play to his or her hand.

name: Phoenix Queen
effect:
Destroy all items borne by a PC who loses a fight to Phoenix Queen.
Some birds are attracted to shiny objects.
To Play/To Flip: Discard 4 PCs.
Reward: Play two cards from your discard pile.

name: Piros
effect: Hark! He of fair eyes! Let us join in an adventure!

name: Plate Armor
effect:
When you play this item, you may discard a card.
Weaker PCs cannot wear such heavy armor.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer may be any PC except a Wavemaster, Twin Blade, or Long Arm.

name: Quiet, Eternal, White Devil
effect:
When a [Water] monster loses a fight by only 1 strength, its owner may sacrifice a card to score that monster.
Water is boundless and eternal.

name: Raging, Passionate, Melody
effect:
Each [Fire] monster in a portal may attack when another monster attacks.
Multiple fires can join to create an inferno.

name: Rai Repulse
effect:
Give that Long Arm strength +2 (or +3 if fighting a [Darkness] monster).
Spin the spear in one hand and slash repeatedly.
To Play/To Flip: Your Long Arm must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Recorder
effect:
Place the monsters in your score pile into a separate saved score pile. Cards in a saved score pile cannot be removed from that pile.
Welcome! How about saving your adventure?

name: Red Scissors
effect:
The shell of this crablike enemy conceals other monsters.
To Play/To Flip: Play 3 storable monsters from your score pile to your portal.
Reward: Score up to 3 of your hidden [Water] monsters.

name: Repth
effect:
Prevent that wound.
Restore 150 HP.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Water]. Your PC must be about to take a wound.

name: Resurrect
effect:
Play a PC from your discard pile. You may also play an item on that PC from your discard pile.
Revive a dead ally.

name: Rondo
effect:
Good beginner sword for a Blademaster PC.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Blademaster.

name: Rue Tornado
effect:
Give that Heavy Axeman strength +3 (or +4 if fighting a [Fire] monster).
Hold the weapon parallel and spin sideways.
To Play/To Flip: Your Heavy Axeman must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Scarlet King
effect:
Its precise attack is strengthened by magic.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 3 scored plants.
Reward: On his or her next turn, your opponent can play only monsters and hidden cards.

name: Scorpion Tank
effect:
Storable – may attack when a crustacean attacks.
This mechanical monster conceals its tracks.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Play a hidden card.

name: Shanato
effect:
When you play this item, you may make your opponent sacrifice a card.
Strength born of the earth for a Heavy Blade.
To Play/To Flip: Place 2 [Earth] cards from your discard pile on top of your deck OR sacrifice a lv. 1 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Heavy Blade.

name: Shidan
effect:
When you play this item, you may play an action from your discard pile.
A fine weapon that enhances the ability of any Heavy Blade.
To Play/To Flip: Place 2 [Wood] cards from your discard pile on top of your deck OR sacrifice a lv. 1 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Heavy Blade.

name: Shining Eyes
effect:
On a moonless field, the eyes are all you see.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Darkness] [Darkness].
Reward: Wound a PC.

name: Sinking, Solitary, March
effect:
An attack involving a [Wood] monster cannot be avoided, if possible.
Sometimes you can’t see the forest for the trees.

name: Skeith
effect:
A PC that loses a fight to Skeith is destroyed.
Phase: 1 – The Terror of Death
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice three PCs, each bearing a weapon.
Reward: No reward.

name: Sky Fish
effect:
Storable – may attack when a fish attacks.
Small but dangerous when they fight in schools.
To Play/To Flip: Spot a hidden card.
Reward: Heal a PC.

name: Sled Dog
effect:
Storable.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire].
Reward: Return 2 of your cards in play to your hand. If both of them are [Fire], destroy a monster.

name: Snappy Grass
effect:
Has jaws that snap shut like a Venus flytrap.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 2 scored plants.
Reward: Your opponent sacrifices a card. He or she may prevent this by playing an item.

name: Sora
effect:
When Sora wins a fight, you may wound a PC.
Tell me, what do you think of my style?

name: Spark Blades
effect:
Simple Twin Blade weapon with a high fire rating.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Twin Blade.

name: Spring Of Myst
effect:
Draw 2 cards.
This spring has a strange feel. Maybe I should throw in a weapon or a piece of armor.

name: Sprite Ocarina
effect:
Each player sacrifices a monster in his or her portal, if possible.
Warp from the dungeon and return to the field.

name: Squilla Demon
effect:
Storable – may attack when a crustacean attacks.
A powerful water monster that hunts in packs.
To Play/To Flip: Play a storable monster from your score pile to your portal.
Reward: Score one of your hidden [Water] monsters.

name: Strormer Spear
effect:
When you play this item, name a card type. Your opponent places all cards of that type from his or her discard pile under his or her deck.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a lv. 2 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Long Arm.

name: Subaru
effect:
When your opponent’s monsters attack, you may look at the top card of your deck and your opponent’s deck.
For now, we only need to learn the truth.

name: Swirling Dark
effect:
Give that Twin Blade strength +2 (or +3 if fighting a [Thunder] monster).
Spin like a top and slash at high speed.
To Play/To Flip: Your Twin Blade must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Swordmanoid
effect:
Storable – may attack when a warrior attacks.
A deadly blade-wielding automaton.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Opponent places a card from his or her discard pile under his or her deck.

name: Tetra Armor
effect:
It has four ways to kill you.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder].
Reward: Destroy all items.

name: Vak Drive
effect:
Give that Heavy Blade strength +2 (or +3 if fighting a [Water] monster).
Powerful attack above and below the waist.
To Play/To Flip: Your Wavemaster must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Water God Axe
effect:
When you play this item, you may look at your opponent’s hidden cards and place 1 of them on top of his or her deck.
The water element allows the seeing of secrets.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a lv. 1 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Heavy Axeman.

name: Water Spear
effect:
Standard water-based Long Arm weapon.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Long Arm.

name: Water Witch
effect:
Storable – may attack when a [Water] monster attacks. On the turn this witch attacks, you may make your opponent redraw destiny once.
To Play/To Flip: Place 2 [Water] cards from your hand on top of your deck.
Reward: No reward.

name: Woman In White
effect:
Search your deck for a card (except a monster card) and take it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.
The mysterious player known as Helba is rumored to be a skilled hacker.

name: Wood Harpy
effect:
Storable – may attack when a [Wood] monster attacks.
The rending attack of its talons leaves little behind.
To Play/To Flip: Discard 2 PCs.
Reward: Play an item from your discard pile.

name: Wood Stock
effect:
This gigantic treelike plant has enhanced defense against magical attacks.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 4 scored plants.
Reward: Your opponent sacrifices two cards. He or she may prevent this by playing 2 PCs or 2 items.

name: Wyrm Hide
effect:
Armor made from lizard skin.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer may be any PC except a Wavemaster.

name: Yuji
effect:
When you draw destiny for your PC, if that destiny card is an item, you may play it.
Oh, hello there.
